description: Hey this is my profile/bio
Hometown: Wellington, New Zealand
Studied: Engineering at The University of Auckland, Auckland, New Zealand
Languages: English (native), French (basic)

profile.title: Professional Overview
description: A reliable and determined software engineer with experience developing creative solutions in the high tech industry for the past few years.
Strong focus on object orientated and test driven designs in an agile environment.
Broad software knowledge in a range of areas, such as C, C++ and C#, both in the embedded and application domains.

education.title: Bachelor of Electrical and Electronic Engineering
description: Graduated with First Class Honours
Focus on software and embedded systems design

education.title: Engineering Part IV Research Project Competition
description: Won First place
Project:  Distributed Context-Aware Intelligent Environment
Category: Parallel and Distributed Systems

education.title: KickStart City of Sails Scholarship
description: Received scholarship for academic merit granted by The University of Auckland

work.title: Communications Station 3
description: Developed a C++ application running on an ARM based embedded Linux system for handling radio communication between central control and field units
Organised and lead sprint planning, reviews and daily stand ups in an agile scrum environment
Collaborated with hardware engineers in testing and debugging sensor interface boards as well as hardware configurations for different system variants
Worked closely with internal stakeholders and systems engineers to ensure smooth integration and customer satisfaction
Designed an asynchronous hardware interface using Boost ASIO to communicate with various sensors and hardware components over I2C
Test driven design using a CppUnit based test framework
Created a Raspberry Pi based simulation for physical hardware devices to improve development velocity
Implemented an easy to user settings system and user interface for improved customer satisfaction

work.title: UCG Application
description: Developed a C# universal windows platform application for user interaction with devices in the field
Tested using NUnit

work.title: Data Converter Application
description: Design of a C# based Univeral Windows Platform project for handling network interactions with central control and Bluetooth communications with field based devices
Involved in the end-to-end design of the system and message handling
Worked closely with embedded and systems engineers in creating a simple automated Bluetooth pairing system for use in the field
Involved in running sprint planning, reviews and daily stand ups
Test driven design using NUnit framework

work.title: Mirror Port Application
description: Developed a C#, Windows based application to act as a lite version of the main control interface for quick and easy deployment in the field
Created internal protocol translation libraries and accompanying tests in C# which were added to the software testing and development framework
Automated hardware setup in a plug-and-play style for simple deployment and user satisfaction
Test driven design using NUnit

work.title: Field Interface
description: Developed functionality for legacy application processing data received by and destined for field based devices
Improved test coverage through Python unit and functional tests using PyTest framework

work.title: Communications Station 2
description: Legacy C based project for handling radio communications between field and central control
Upgraded legacy C code to C++, adding Object Orientation and additional features desired by customers
Improved test coverage and added to the CppUnit based testing framework

work.title: 4G Communications Link
description: Designed an Android application to communicate with an embedded laser receiver via Bluetooth and forward data over a 4G network
Added the required Bluetooth link to the aforementioned laser receiver in embedded C
Successfully demonstrated proof of concept for upgrading the existing radio communication link to a higher bandwidth 4G connection

work.title: Auckland Electrification Project
description: Mapped fibre communication nodes in the newly electrified rail network using RNMS
GPS based tracking and logging of sensors and communication node locations
Hands-on experience with tools and equipment assessing hardware in the field
